# **Why OpenDroneMap?**

- Open-source photogrammetry ecosystem  
- Replaces commercial tools (Agisoft, Pix4D) in many workflows  
- Ideal for teaching, research, reproducibility  
- Actively maintained
- Community-driven (UAV4GEO, Public Lab, HOTOSM)

# **What is OpenDroneMap?**

## ODM Ecosystem {.smaller}

- [ODM](https://opendronemap.org/odm/) is a command-line photogrammetry processing engine [@opendronemap_odm_2020].
- [NodeODM](https://opendronemap.org/nodeodm/) is a REST API to access ODM. 
- [WebODM](https://opendronemap.org/webodm/) is a Web/GUI interface for ODM.
- [CloudODM](https://opendronemap.org/cloudodm/) is a command line client to work with ODM with **NodeODM**.
- [PyODM](https://opendronemap.org/pyodm/) is a Python SDK for scripting with ODM.
- [ClusterODM](https://opendronemap.org/clusterodm/) is a NodeODM API compatible reverse proxy, load balancer and task tracker for easy horizontal scaling.
- [NodeMICMAC](https://opendronemap.org/nodemicmac/) is a Node.js App and REST API to access [MicMac](https://github.com/micmacIGN/micmac).
- [FIELDimage](https://www.opendronemap.org/fieldimager/) - is a Tool to Analyze Images From Agricultural Field Trials and Lab in R (@matias_fieldimager_2020, @pawar_fieldimagerextra_2023).
- [Find-GCP](https://opendronemap.org/findgcp/) - Find ArUco markers in digital photos (@siki_automatic_2021).

## ODM Architecture {.smaller}

- [ODM](https://opendronemap.org/odm/) Command-line engine (@opendronemap_odm_2020)
- Built from modular components:  
  - [OpenSfM](https://opensfm.org/) -- SfM + Bundle Adjustment  
  - [openMVS](https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS) -- Dense reconstruction
  - [MicMac](https://github.com/micmacIGN/micmac) -- (Optional) photogrammetry processing engine
  - [PDAL](https://pdal.io/en/stable/) -- Point cloud processing (@pdal_contributors_2025_2616780)
  - [Entwine](https://entwine.io/en/latest/) -- Point cloud data organization library
  - [GDAL](https://gdal.org/en/stable/) -- Raster operations 
  - [PoissonRecon](https://github.com/mkazhdan/PoissonRecon) -- 3D mesh
  - [MSV Texturing](https://github.com/nmoehrle/mvs-texturing) -- Mesh Texturing
  - [GRASS](https://grass.osgeo.org/) -- geospatial compuational engine (@GRASS_Development_Team_and_Landa_GRASS_GIS)

## Platform and Hardware Requirements {.smaller}

### Platforms

Through [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/get-docker/) ODM, NodeODM, and WebODM run on:

- Windows
- MacOS
- Linux 

::: {.callout-note}
Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications.
For more information visit [What is Docker?](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/docker-overview/).
:::

*Recommendations from (@OpenDroneMapTheMissingGuide_2023)*


## Hardware Requirements {.smaller}

::: {.columns}
:::{.column width="50%"}
#### Minimum requirements

- 64 bit CPU (manufactured post-2010)
- 20 GB of disk space
- 4 GB of RAM

> Can process no more than 100-200 images.
:::
:::{.column width="50%"}
#### Recommended requirements

- Latest generation CPU
- 100 GB disk space
- 16 GB RAM
:::
:::

::: {.callout-note}
NVIDIA GPU can be used to speed up processing.
:::

*Recommendations from [@OpenDroneMapTheMissingGuide_2023]*

## ODM Capabilities {.smaller}

- Feature detection ([SIFT](https://scikit-image.org/docs/0.25.x/auto_examples/features_detection/plot_sift.html)-like)
- Bundle adjustment
- Dense cloud generation
- DSM & DTM creation
- Orthomosaic generation
- Meshing & texturing
- Ground/non-ground classification  
- QC & reports  
- GCP support

```{mermaid}

    end
```

# **WebODM** {.text-center}

[![](images/webodm-icon-64x64.png)](https://www.opendronemap.org/webodm/){fig-align="center"}

## WebODM Overview

- Browser-based interface to ODM
- Easy installation via Docker
- Project-based workflow
- Supports GCP import
- Built-in 2D and 3D viewers
- Plugin ecosystem (Contours, Volume, Reports)

## Basic WebODM Workflow

1. Create project
2. Upload images
3. (Optional) Upload GCP file
4. Run processing
5. Inspect outputs
6. Export and analyze in GRASS

# *ODM vs Agisoft Metashape*

## Strengths of ODM

- 100% open-source
- Transparent algorithms
- Strong reproducibility
- Easy scripting/automation
- Works well with GRASS/QGIS
- Excellent orthomosaics for natural scenes

## Limitations of ODM

- Slower than Metashape
- Mesh reconstruction less refined
- GUI less polished (WebODM improves this)
- Multispectral workflows less robust
- Struggles with highly oblique imagery

## Comparison Table { .text-center }

| Capability          | ODM        | WebODM       | Agisoft      |
| ------------------- | ---------- | ------------ | ------------ |
| Cost                | Free       | Free         | $$$          |
| Orthomosaic         | Excellent  | Excellent    | Excellent    |
| Dense Cloud Quality | Good       | Good         | Excellent    |
| GUI                 | Basic CLI  | Browser GUI  | Professional |
| Speed               | Slower     | Slower       | Very fast    |
| Scripting           | Excellent  | Good         | Good         |
| GCP Handling        | Good       | Good         | Excellent    |
